abortable-fetch.description: If you construct a fetch request with an AbortSignal, you can cancel the request.
abortable-fetch.description_html: If you construct a fetch request with an AbortSignal, you can cancel the request.
abortable-fetch.name: Abortable fetch

aborting.description: The AbortController and AbortSignal APIs allow you to cancel an ongoing operation, such as a fetch() request.
aborting.description_html: The AbortController and AbortSignal APIs allow you to cancel an ongoing operation, such as a fetch() request.
aborting.name: AbortController and AbortSignal

abortsignal-any.description: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.
abortsignal-any.description_html: The AbortSignal.any() static method combines an iterable of abort signals into a single signal, with the abort reason taken from the first signal to abort.
abortsignal-any.name: AbortSignal.any()

abs-sign.description: The abs() and sign() CSS functions compute the absolute value or the sign of the input.
abs-sign.description_html: The abs() and sign() CSS functions compute the absolute value or the sign of the input.
abs-sign.name: abs() and sign()

accelerometer.description: The Accelerometer and LinearAccelerationSensor APIs read the acceleration applied to a device in three dimensions, either including the effect of gravity or not, respectively.
accelerometer.description_html: The Accelerometer and LinearAccelerationSensor APIs read the acceleration applied to a device in three dimensions, either including the effect of gravity or not, respectively.
accelerometer.name: Accelerometer

accent-color.description: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
accent-color.description_html: The accent-color CSS property sets a color for checkboxes, radio buttons, and other form controls.
accent-color.name: accent-color

anchor-positioning.description: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
anchor-positioning.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
anchor-positioning.name: Anchor positioning

animation-composition.description: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.
animation-composition.description_html: The animation-composition CSS property chooses how to combine animations that affect the same property.
animation-composition.name: animation-composition

appearance.description: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.
appearance.description_html: The appearance CSS property controls the appearance of form controls. Using appearance: none disables any default native appearance and allows the elements to be styled with CSS.
appearance.name: appearance

aria-attribute-reflection.description: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.
aria-attribute-reflection.description_html: WAI-ARIA attributes have corresponding properties on Element and ElementInternals objects.
aria-attribute-reflection.name: ARIA attribute reflection

array.description: Arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values.
array.description_html: Arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values.
array.name: Array (initial support)

array-at.description: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.
array-at.description_html: The at() method of arrays and typed arrays returns the item at an index, including negative indices for getting items relative to the end of an array. Also known as the relative indexing method.
array-at.name: Array at()

array-by-copy.description: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.
array-by-copy.description_html: The toReversed(), toSorted(), toSpliced(), and with() methods of arrays and typed arrays return changed copies of arrays. They stand in contrast to methods such as sort() or reverse() that change arrays in place.
array-by-copy.name: Array by copy

array-copywithin.description: The copyWithin() method of arrays and typed arrays shifts or copies items of an array to another index of the array without changing its length.
array-copywithin.description_html: The copyWithin() method of arrays and typed arrays shifts or copies items of an array to another index of the array without changing its length.
array-copywithin.name: Array copyWithin()

array-fill.description: The fill() method of arrays and typed arrays sets all or some items of an array to a given a value.
array-fill.description_html: The fill() method of arrays and typed arrays sets all or some items of an array to a given a value.
array-fill.name: Array fill()

array-find.description: The find() and findIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-find.description_html: The find() and findIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-find.name: Array find() and findIndex()

array-findlast.description: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-findlast.description_html: The findLast() and findLastIndex() methods of arrays and typed arrays search an array in reverse order for the first item that satisfies a test function.
array-findlast.name: Array findLast() and findLastIndex()

array-flat.description: The flat() and flatMap() methods for arrays creates a new array such that each nested array item is concatenated into it.
array-flat.description_html: The flat() and flatMap() methods for arrays creates a new array such that each nested array item is concatenated into it.
array-flat.name: Array flat() and flatMap()

array-from.description: The Array.from() and typed array .from() static methods copy items from an iterable or array-like object to make a new array.
array-from.description_html: The Array.from() and typed array .from() static methods copy items from an iterable or array-like object to make a new array.
array-from.name: Array.from()

array-fromasync.description: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.
array-fromasync.description_html: The Array.fromAsync() static method copies items from an async iterable object to make a new array.
array-fromasync.name: Array.fromAsync()

array-group.description: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.
array-group.description_html: The Object.groupBy() and Map.groupBy() static methods group values of arrays and iterables based on a function that returns a key for each value.
array-group.name: Array grouping

array-includes.description: The includes() method of arrays and typed arrays returns whether a given value appears in the array.
array-includes.description_html: The includes() method of arrays and typed arrays returns whether a given value appears in the array.
array-includes.name: Array includes()

array-isarray.description: The Array.isArray() static method checks whether a value is an array.
array-isarray.description_html: The Array.isArray() static method checks whether a value is an array.
array-isarray.name: Array.isArray()

array-iterators.description: Arrays are iterable with the for…of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
array-iterators.description_html: Arrays are iterable with the for…of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
array-iterators.name: Array iterators

array-of.description: The Array.of() and typed array .of() static methods create new arrays from the values of any number of arguments.
array-of.description_html: The Array.of() and typed array .of() static methods create new arrays from the values of any number of arguments.
array-of.name: Array.of()

array-splice.description: The array splice() method changes an array in-place. You can use it to delete items, overwrite items, or insert items, starting from an index.
array-splice.description_html: The array splice() method changes an array in-place. You can use it to delete items, overwrite items, or insert items, starting from an index.
array-splice.name: Array splice()

aspect-ratio.description: The aspect-ratio CSS property controls the width-to-height ratio of elements. For and
aspect-ratio.description_html: The aspect-ratio CSS property controls the width-to-height ratio of elements. For <img> and <video> elements, the width and height attributes used together with height: auto control the aspect ratio while the image/video is loading.
aspect-ratio.name: aspect-ratio

async-await.description: The async and await keywords allow you to use the asynchronous, promise-based behavior of a function without using promise chains.
async-await.description_html: The async and await keywords allow you to use the asynchronous, promise-based behavior of a function without using promise chains.
async-await.name: Async functions

async-clipboard.description: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.
async-clipboard.description_html: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.
async-clipboard.name: Async clipboard

async-iterable-streams.description: Asynchronous iteration of a stream allows you to use for await...of loops to iterate through a stream's incoming data.
async-iterable-streams.description_html: Asynchronous iteration of a stream allows you to use for await...of loops to iterate through a stream's incoming data.
async-iterable-streams.name: Asynchronously iterable streams

audio-session.description: The navigator.audioSession API controls how audio playback interacts with other applications. For example, playing music can pause audio from other applications, while ambient audio can play at the same time.
audio-session.description_html: The navigator.audioSession API controls how audio playback interacts with other applications. For example, playing music can pause audio from other applications, while ambient audio can play at the same time.
audio-session.name: Audio session

audio-video-tracks.description: The audioTracks and videoTracks APIs for media elements switch audio and video tracks during playback.
audio-video-tracks.description_html: The audioTracks and videoTracks APIs for media elements switch audio and video tracks during playback.
audio-video-tracks.name: Audio and video tracks

autofill.description: The :autofill pseudo-class matches <input> elements that have been filled in automatically by the browser.
autofill.description_html: The :autofill pseudo-class matches <input> elements that have been filled in automatically by the browser.
autofill.name: :autofill

autofocus.description: The autofocus HTML attribute gives focus to an element on page load.
autofocus.description_html: The autofocus HTML attribute gives focus to an element on page load.
autofocus.name: Autofocus

autonomous-custom-elements.description: Autonomous custom elements are HTML elements with a hyphenated tag name (like <example-element>) that have behaviors you define.
autonomous-custom-elements.description_html: Autonomous custom elements are HTML elements with a hyphenated tag name (like <example-element>) that have behaviors you define.
autonomous-custom-elements.name: Autonomous custom elements

avif.description: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.
avif.description_html: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is an image format based on the AV1 video format.
avif.name: AVIF

backdrop-filter.description: The backdrop-filter CSS property applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.
backdrop-filter.description_html: The backdrop-filter CSS property applies graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.
backdrop-filter.name: backdrop-filter

background-clip.description: The background-clip CSS property sets the extent of the background: the padding box, the content box, or the default border box.
background-clip.description_html: The background-clip CSS property sets the extent of the background: the padding box, the content box, or the default border box.
background-clip.name: background-clip

background-clip-text.description: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element.
background-clip-text.description_html: The background-clip: text CSS declaration draws the background underneath only the text in the element.
background-clip-text.name: background-clip: text

background-fetch.description: Background fetch downloads data in the background even when the web page is closed.
background-fetch.description_html: Background fetch downloads data in the background even when the web page is closed.
background-fetch.name: Background fetch

baseline-source.description: The baseline-source CSS property controls how inline-level boxes with multiple lines of text are aligned with the surrounding text. By default, which typographic baseline is used depends on the display property value.
baseline-source.description_html: The baseline-source CSS property controls how inline-level boxes with multiple lines of text are aligned with the surrounding text. By default, which typographic baseline is used depends on the display property value.
baseline-source.name: baseline-source

bigint.description: The BigInt JavaScript type represents integers of any size, including integers too large for the primitive Number type.
bigint.description_html: The BigInt JavaScript type represents integers of any size, including integers too large for the primitive Number type.
bigint.name: BigInt

blocking-render.description: The blocking="render" attribute for <link>, <script>, and <style> elements blocks rendering until the external script or stylesheet has been loaded. For <link rel="expect">, rendering is blocked until a specific element is in the DOM.
blocking-render.description_html: The blocking="render" attribute for <link>, <script>, and <style> elements blocks rendering until the external script or stylesheet has been loaded. For <link rel="expect">, rendering is blocked until a specific element is in the DOM.

border-image.description: The border-image CSS property draws an image around an element.
border-image.description_html: The border-image CSS property draws an image around an element.

broadcast-channel.description: The BroadcastChannel API allows you to send messages between same-origin browsing contexts, such as between the same page loaded in multiple tabs.
broadcast-channel.description_html: The BroadcastChannel API allows you to send messages between same-origin browsing contexts, such as between the same page loaded in multiple tabs.
broadcast-channel.name: BroadcastChannel

calc.description: The calc() CSS function computes mathematical expressions such a calc(100%/3 - 1em).
calc.description_html: The calc() CSS function computes mathematical expressions such a calc(100%/3 - 1em).
calc.name: calc()

calc-constants.description: The e, pi, infinity, and NaN constants are accepted in CSS math functions such as calc().
calc-constants.description_html: The e, pi, infinity, and NaN constants are accepted in CSS math functions such as calc().
calc-constants.name: calc() constants

canvas-context-lost.description: The contextlost event for <canvas> fires when the canvas backing storage is lost, while the contextrestored event fires when it is recreated.

canvas-createconicgradient.description_html: The createConicGradient() methods draw a conic gradient to a 2D canvas.

canvas-reset.description: The reset() method clears a canvas to its initial state.
canvas-reset.description_html: The reset() method clears a canvas to its initial state.
canvas-reset.name: Canvas reset()

canvas-roundrect.description: The roundRect() methods draw a rounded rectangle to a 2D canvas.
canvas-roundrect.description_html: The roundRect() methods draw a rounded rectangle to a 2D canvas.
canvas-roundrect.name: Canvas roundRect()

canvas-text.description: The fillText() and  strokeText() methods draw text to a 2D canvas. The measureText() method measures the width and other metrics which can be used to position the text.
canvas-text.description_html: The fillText() and strokeText() methods draw text to a 2D canvas. The measureText() method measures the width and other metrics which can be used to position the text.

canvas-text-baselines.name: Canvas text baselines

cap.description_html: The CSS cap unit corresponds to the height of Latin capital letters.

cascade-layers.description: The @layer CSS at-rule avoids specificity conflicts by providing priority levels for different groups of CSS rules, such as low-priority styles like resets, and high-priority styles like UI components.
cascade-layers.description_html: The @layer CSS at-rule avoids specificity conflicts by providing priority levels for different groups of CSS rules, such as low-priority styles like resets, and high-priority styles like UI components.

check-visibility.description: The checkVisibility() method checks if an element is potentially visible, with optional parameters for the kinds of visibility to check. For example, it checks whether the element has the style display: none, but can also check for visibility: hidden.

class-syntax.description: Classes are an object-oriented syntax for JavaScript prototypes.
class-syntax.description_html: Classes are an object-oriented syntax for JavaScript prototypes.

clipboard-supports.description: The ClipboardItem.supports() static method checks if the browser supports writing data types such as "image/svg+xml" or other custom formats to the system clipboard.
clipboard-supports.description_html: The ClipboardItem.supports() static method checks if the browser supports writing data types such as "image/svg+xml" or other custom formats to the system clipboard.

clipboard-unsanitized-formats.description: The optional formats.unsanitized parameter of the navigator.clipboard.read() method reads unsanitized data from the system clipboard.
clipboard-unsanitized-formats.description_html: The optional formats.unsanitized parameter of the navigator.clipboard.read() method reads unsanitized data from the system clipboard.

color-function.description: The color() function defines a color within a given color space. Wide gamut color spaces like display-p3 allow showing more vibrant and saturated colors than the standard srgb color space.
color-function.description_html: The color() function defines a color within a given color space. Wide gamut color spaces like display-p3 allow showing more vibrant and saturated colors than the standard srgb color space.
color-function.name: color()

color-mix.description: The color-mix() function mixes two colors in a given color space and by a given amount. Commonly, lighter or darker variations of a color are created by mixing with white or black.
color-mix.description_html: The color-mix() function mixes two colors in a given color space and by a given amount. Commonly, lighter or darker variations of a color are created by mixing with white or black.
color-mix.name: color-mix()

color-scheme.description: The color-scheme CSS property sets which color schemes (light or dark) an element uses and may prevent automatic dark mode adjustments by the browser.
color-scheme.description_html: The color-scheme CSS property sets which color schemes (light or dark) an element uses and may prevent automatic dark mode adjustments by the browser.

colrv1.description: COLRv1 is a font format that supports multi-color glyphs.
colrv1.description_html: COLRv1 is a font format that supports multi-color glyphs.
colrv1.name: COLRv1

column-breaks.description: In columnar layouts (created by the columns or column-count CSS properties), the break-after, break-before, break-inside properties control where columns start or end.
column-breaks.description_html: In columnar layouts (created by the columns or column-count CSS properties), the break-after, break-before, break-inside properties control where columns start or end.

compression-streams.description: The CompressionStream and DecompressionStream interfaces compress and decompress data using the gzip or deflate formats.
compression-streams.description_html: The CompressionStream and DecompressionStream interfaces compress and decompress data using the gzip or deflate formats.
compression-streams.name: Compression streams

compute-pressure.description: The PressureObserver API monitors CPU load, allowing you to adjust workloads in response to available computing resources. Also known as the Compute Pressure API.
compute-pressure.description_html: The PressureObserver API monitors CPU load, allowing you to adjust workloads in response to available computing resources. Also known as the Compute Pressure API.

conic-gradients.description: The conic-gradient() and repeating-conic-gradient() CSS functions create backgrounds that progress between two or more colors around a center point.

constraint-validation.description: Methods that validate form controls before submission, such as checkValidity(), reportValidity() and setCustomValidity().
constraint-validation.description_html: Methods that validate form controls before submission, such as checkValidity(), reportValidity() and setCustomValidity().
constraint-validation.name: Constraint validation API

constructed-stylesheets.description: The CSSStyleSheet constructor creates a new stylesheet which can be shared between a document and multiple shadow roots using adoptedStyleSheets.
constructed-stylesheets.description_html: The CSSStyleSheet constructor creates a new stylesheet which can be shared between a document and multiple shadow roots using adoptedStyleSheets.
constructed-stylesheets.name: Constructed stylesheets

contact-picker.description: The navigator.contacts API allows you to ask users to share limited details about entries in their contact list with your application.
contact-picker.description_html: The navigator.contacts API allows you to ask users to share limited details about entries in their contact list with your application.
contact-picker.name: Contact picker

contain-intrinsic-size.description: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will lay out the element as if it had a single child of this size.
contain-intrinsic-size.description_html: The contain-intrinsic-size CSS property sets the intrinsic size of an element. When using size containment, the browser will lay out the element as if it had a single child of this size.

container-queries.description: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.
container-queries.description_html: Container size queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the dimensions of its container.

container-style-queries.description: Container style queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the values of custom properties of its container.
container-style-queries.description_html: Container style queries with the @container at-rule apply styles to an element based on the values of custom properties of its container.
container-style-queries.name: Container style queries

content-visibility.description: The content-visibility CSS property delays rendering an element, including layout and painting, until it is needed.
content-visibility.description_html: The content-visibility CSS property delays rendering an element, including layout and painting, until it is needed.

controls-list.description: The controlslist attribute for <audio> or <video> hides parts of the browser's built-in controls. For example, controlslist="nofullscreen" removes the button to play the video in fullscreen.

controls-list.name: controlslist

counter-set.description: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.
counter-set.description_html: The counter-set CSS property creates (and optionally sets a value for) a counter, the numbers for a series of headings or ordered list items.
counter-set.name: counter-set

counter-style.description: The @counter-style CSS at-rule defines custom counter styles for list items. For example, you can use a sequence of specific symbols instead of numbers for an ordered list.
counter-style.description_html: The @counter-style CSS at-rule defines custom counter styles for list items. For example, you can use a sequence of specific symbols instead of numbers for an ordered list.
counter-style.name: @counter-style

css-modules.description: Module `import ... with { type: "css" } statements load CSS modules as constructable stylesheets. Also known as CSS module scripts and formerly known as import assertions.
css-modules.description_html: Module `import ... with { type: "css" } statements load CSS modules as constructable stylesheets. Also known as CSS module scripts and formerly known as import assertions.

custom-properties.description: Custom properties are CSS properties prefixed with -- that set values you can reuse with the var() function. For example, you can set a --key-color property to reuse as border-color: var(--key-color). Also known as CSS variables.
custom-properties.description_html: Custom properties are CSS properties prefixed with -- that set values you can reuse with the var() function. For example, you can set a --key-color property to reuse as border-color: var(--key-color). Also known as CSS variables.
custom-properties.name: Custom properties

customized-built-in-elements.description: Customized built-in elements are HTML elements that extend built-in elements using the is attribute, to add new behaviors that you define.
customized-built-in-elements.description_html: Customized built-in elements are HTML elements that extend built-in elements using the is attribute, to add new behaviors that you define.
customized-built-in-elements.name: Customized built-in elements

datalist.description: The <datalist> element defines a set of recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all options, or matching options as the user types.
datalist.description_html: The <datalist> element defines a set of recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all options, or matching options as the user types.

declarative-shadow-dom.description: The shadowrootmode attribute on <template> creates a shadow root without the use of JavaScript. It is a declarative alternative to the attachShadow() method.

default.description: The :default CSS pseudo-class matches the default element in a group of related form controls, such as checkboxes and radio buttons with the checked attribute.
default.description_html: The :default CSS pseudo-class matches the default element in a group of related form controls, such as checkboxes and radio buttons with the checked attribute.
default.name: :default

details.description: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.

details-name.description: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.

device-posture.name: Device posture

dialog.description: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
dialog.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
dialog.name: <dialog>

dir-pseudo.description: The :dir() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements by text direction, either right to left (rtl) or left to right (ltr).
dir-pseudo.description_html: The :dir() CSS functional pseudo-class matches elements by text direction, either right to left (rtl) or left to right (ltr).

display-animation.description: You can animate elements between display: none and any other display value or animate between content-visibility: hidden and any other content-visibility value. This also applies to transitions.

document-picture-in-picture.description: The document picture-in-picture API creates an always-on-top window from arbitrary HTML content.

font-size-adjust.description: The font-size-adjust CSS property preserves apparent text size, regardless of the font used, by scaling fonts to the same size with respect to a specific metric, such as x-height. This can help make fallback fonts look the same size.

js-modules.description: JavaScript modules allow code to be organized into reusable units. Modules use import to load other modules and export to declare what is available to import from other modules. In HTML, modules are loaded with <script type="module">.

lab.description: The CIE Lab color space expresses colors in terms of lightness and how red/green and blue/yellow a color is. LCH is a variant of Lab with polar coordinates. These color spaces can be used with the CSS color(), lab(), and lch() functions. Also known as CIELAB and CIELCH.

media-query-range-syntax.description: The range syntax of CSS media queries allows you to use mathematical comparison operators such as <, >, <=, and >= to define a range of values for a media feature. For example, (400px < width < 1000px) returns true if the viewport width is between 400px and 1000px.

orientation-sensor.description_html: The AbsoluteOrientationSensor and RelativeOrientationSensor APIs describe the physical orientation of a device in three-dimensional space, either in relation to the Earth's coordinate system or in relation to the device's own orientation, respectively.
orientation-sensor.name: Orientation Sensor

origin-private-file-system.description: The navigator.storage.getDirectory() method returns a FileSystemDirectoryHandle that is restricted to a specific origin and invisible to the user's actual file system for faster file-based applications, such as SQLite databases.
origin-private-file-system.description_html: The navigator.storage.getDirectory() method returns a FileSystemDirectoryHandle that is restricted to a specific origin and invisible to the user's actual file system for faster file-based applications, such as SQLite databases.
origin-private-file-system.name: Origin private file system

overflow-shorthand.description: The overflow CSS property sets the behavior for when content doesn't fit in an element.
overflow-shorthand.description_html: The overflow CSS property sets the behavior for when content doesn't fit in an element.
overflow-shorthand.name: overflow

overlay.description: The overlay CSS property, used as an allow-discrete CSS transition, prevents a top layer element, such as a popover or a <dialog>, from being removed from the top layer before it has finished animating. You can't set the value of the overlay property; only use it as transition property.
overlay.description_html: The overlay CSS property, used as an allow-discrete CSS transition, prevents a top layer element, such as a popover or a <dialog>, from being removed from the top layer before it has finished animating. You can't set the value of the overlay property; only use it as transition property.
overlay.name: overlay

page-breaks.description: The break-after, break-before, break-inside CSS properties (along with page-break- aliases) control where printed pages start and end. Also known as pagination or page breaking.
page-breaks.description_html: The break-after, break-before, break-inside CSS properties (along with page-break- aliases) control where printed pages start and end. Also known as pagination or page breaking.
page-breaks.name: Page breaks

paint.description: The paint() CSS function creates a custom image, drawn using a paint worklet, for an element's background or border.
paint.description_html: The paint() CSS function creates a custom image, drawn using a paint worklet, for an element's background or border.
paint.name: paint()

parse-html-unsafe.description: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
parse-html-unsafe.description_html: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
parse-html-unsafe.name: Unsanitized HTML parsing methods

permissions.description: The navigator.permissions API checks whether a permission, such as access to geolocation data, has been granted.
permissions.description_html: The navigator.permissions API checks whether a permission, such as access to geolocation data, has been granted.
permissions.name: Permissions

picture-in-picture.description: The picture-in-picture API allow websites to create a floating, always-on-top video window. Also known as PiP or pop-out video.
picture-in-picture.description_html: The picture-in-picture API allow websites to create a floating, always-on-top video window. Also known as PiP or pop-out video.
picture-in-picture.name: Picture-in-picture (video)

pointer-lock.description: Provides access to raw mouse movement by locking the target of mouse events to a single element and hiding the mouse cursor.
pointer-lock.description_html: Provides access to raw mouse movement by locking the target of mouse events to a single element and hiding the mouse cursor.
pointer-lock.name: Pointer lock

popover.description: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
popover.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
popover.name: Popover

prefers-color-scheme.description: The prefers-color-scheme CSS media query detects the requested color scheme, light or dark.
prefers-color-scheme.description_html: The prefers-color-scheme CSS media query detects the requested color scheme, light or dark.
prefers-color-scheme.name: prefers-color-scheme

preloading-responsive-images.description: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
preloading-responsive-images.description_html: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
preloading-responsive-images.name: Preloading responsive images

preserves-pitch.description: The preservesPitch property for <audio> or <video> adjusts the pitch of audio to sound more natural when the playback rate is faster or slower than the default.
preserves-pitch.description_html: The preservesPitch property for <audio> or <video> adjusts the pitch of audio to sound more natural when the playback rate is faster or slower than the default.
preserves-pitch.name: preservesPitch

print.description: The window.print() method opens the browser's print dialog.
print.description_html: The window.print() method opens the browser's print dialog.
print.name: window.print()

print-events.description: An alternative to @media print queries, the beforeprint and afterprint events allow you to change the page for printing and and restore the page after printing.
print-events.description_html: An alternative to @media print queries, the beforeprint and afterprint events allow you to change the page for printing and and restore the page after printing.
print-events.name: Print events

promise.description: A promise represents an asynchronous operation which eventually succeeds or fails.
promise.description_html: A promise represents an asynchronous operation which eventually succeeds or fails.
promise.name: Promise (initial support)

promise-allsettled.description: The Promise.allSettled() static method waits for an array of promises to settle (resolve or reject).
promise-allsettled.description_html: The Promise.allSettled() static method waits for an array of promises to settle (resolve or reject).
promise-allsettled.name: Promise.allSettled()

promise-any.description: The Promise.any() static method returns a promise that fulfills as soon as the first of an iterable of promises fulfills, with that promise's value. Otherwise, it rejects with an AggregateError when all of the promises have rejected.
promise-any.description_html: The Promise.any() static method returns a promise that fulfills as soon as the first of an iterable of promises fulfills, with that promise's value. Otherwise, it rejects with an AggregateError when all of the promises have rejected.
promise-any.name: Promise.any()

promise-finally.description: The promise finally() method executes a function when the promise settles (resolves or rejects).
promise-finally.description_html: The promise finally() method executes a function when the promise settles (resolves or rejects).
promise-finally.name: Promise finally()

promise-withresolvers.description: The Promise.withResolvers() static method is an alternative to the Promise() constructor that returns both the promise and resolution functions. You can use this to access resolve and reject outside the scope of the executor function.
promise-withresolvers.description_html: The Promise.withResolvers() static method is an alternative to the Promise() constructor that returns both the promise and resolution functions. You can use this to access resolve and reject outside the scope of the executor function.
promise-withresolvers.name: Promise.withResolvers()

push.description: The Push API subscribes to and receives server-initiated messages. Subscribers receive pushed messages in the background, even after periods inactive or offline.
push.description_html: The Push API subscribes to and receives server-initiated messages. Subscribers receive pushed messages in the background, even after periods inactive or offline.
push.name: Push messages

read-write-pseudos.description: The :read-only and :read-write CSS pseudo-classes match elements that are read-only or read-write, respectively. For example, :read-only matches <input> and <textarea> elements with the readonly attribute.
read-write-pseudos.description_html: The :read-only and :read-write CSS pseudo-classes match elements that are read-only or read-write, respectively. For example, :read-only matches <input> and <textarea> elements with the readonly attribute.
read-write-pseudos.name: :read-only and :read-write

registered-custom-properties.description: The CSS.registerProperty() static method and the @property CSS at-rule register custom properties for which types and behaviors can be defined.
registered-custom-properties.description_html: The CSS.registerProperty() static method and the @property CSS at-rule register custom properties for which types and behaviors can be defined.
registered-custom-properties.name: Registered custom properties

relative-color.description: The from keyword for color functions (color(), hsl(), oklch(), etc.) creates a new color based on a given color by modifying the values of the input color. Also known as relative color syntax (RCS).
relative-color.description_html: The from keyword for color functions (color(), hsl(), oklch(), etc.) creates a new color based on a given color by modifying the values of the input color. Also known as relative color syntax (RCS).
relative-color.name: Relative colors

request-animation-frame.description: The requestAnimationFrame() method schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. You can use it to animate content with JavaScript.
request-animation-frame.description_html: The requestAnimationFrame() method schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. You can use it to animate content with JavaScript.
request-animation-frame.name: requestAnimationFrame()

request-animation-frame-workers.description: The requestAnimationFrame() method in workers schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. Together with offscreen canvas, you can animate content from a worker.
request-animation-frame-workers.description_html: The requestAnimationFrame() method in workers schedules a function that runs before the next repaint. Together with offscreen canvas, you can animate content from a worker.
request-animation-frame-workers.name: requestAnimationFrame() in workers

request-video-frame-callback.description: The requestVideoFrameCallback() method for <video> schedules a function that runs with the next video frame. It is similar to requestAnimationFrame(), but for video.
request-video-frame-callback.description_html: The requestVideoFrameCallback() method for <video> schedules a function that runs with the next video frame. It is similar to requestAnimationFrame(), but for video.
request-video-frame-callback.name: requestVideoFrameCallback()

resizable-arraybuffer.description: The resize() method of an ArrayBuffer, constructed with the maxByteLength option, changes the size of the buffer in place.
resizable-arraybuffer.description_html: The resize() method of an ArrayBuffer, constructed with the maxByteLength option, changes the size of the buffer in place.
resizable-arraybuffer.name: Resizable ArrayBuffer

resource-size.description: The decodedSize, encodedSize, and transferSize properties of the PerformanceResourceTiming API reports the size of resources loaded.
resource-size.description_html: The decodedSize, encodedSize, and transferSize properties of the PerformanceResourceTiming API reports the size of resources loaded.
resource-size.name: Resource size

resource-timing.description: PerformanceResourceTiming entries report when network events happen while loading a resource, such as when connections start and end. You can use this information to measure loading times.
resource-timing.description_html: PerformanceResourceTiming entries report when network events happen while loading a resource, such as when connections start and end. You can use this information to measure loading times.
resource-timing.name: Resource timing (initial support)

round-mod-rem.description: The round(), mod(), and rem() CSS functions compute rounded values and the remainder after division.
round-mod-rem.description_html: The round(), mod(), and rem() CSS functions compute rounded values and the remainder after division.
round-mod-rem.name: round(), mod(), and rem()

scheduler.description: The scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
scheduler.description_html: The scheduler API provides a way to prioritize all tasks belonging to an application.
scheduler.name: Scheduler API

scope.description: The @scope CSS at-rule sets the scope for a group of rules.
scope.description_html: The @scope CSS at-rule sets the scope for a group of rules.
scope.name: @scope

screen-orientation.description: The screen.orientation API gets information about the orientation of the viewport, such as landscape or portrait. With this API, you can adapt an application's layout or behavior in response to changes in orientation.
screen-orientation.description_html: The screen.orientation API gets information about the orientation of the viewport, such as landscape or portrait. With this API, you can adapt an application's layout or behavior in response to changes in orientation.
screen-orientation.name: Screen orientation

screen-orientation-lock.description: The screen.orientation.lock() method prevents changes to the screen orientation, typically in fullscreen applications such as games. For example, while locked, rotating a phone to the side won't change the screen orientation from landscape to portrait.
screen-orientation-lock.description_html: The screen.orientation.lock() method prevents changes to the screen orientation, typically in fullscreen applications such as games. For example, while locked, rotating a phone to the side won't change the screen orientation from landscape to portrait.
screen-orientation-lock.name: Screen orientation lock

scroll-driven-animations.description: CSS scroll-driven animations are a type of CSS animations that don't run over time, but are instead driven by the user's scroll position.
scroll-driven-animations.description_html: CSS scroll-driven animations are a type of CSS animations that don't run over time, but are instead driven by the user's scroll position.
scroll-driven-animations.name: Scroll-driven animations

scroll-into-view.description: The scrollIntoView() method scrolls an element's ancestor containers such that the element is visible to the user.
scroll-into-view.description_html: The scrollIntoView() method scrolls an element's ancestor containers such that the element is visible to the user.
scroll-into-view.name: scrollIntoView()

scroll-snap.description: CSS scroll snap controls the panning and scrolling behavior within a scroll container.
scroll-snap.description_html: CSS scroll snap controls the panning and scrolling behavior within a scroll container.
scroll-snap.name: Scroll snap

scroll-to-text-fragment.description: Text fragments are URL fragments on the form #:~:text=snippet and link to a snippet of text within a page. The browser may scroll, highlight, or otherwise bring that text to the reader's attention.
scroll-to-text-fragment.description_html: Text fragments are URL fragments on the form #:~:text=snippet and link to a snippet of text within a page. The browser may scroll, highlight, or otherwise bring that text to the reader's attention.
scroll-to-text-fragment.name: Scroll to text fragment

scrollbar-color.description: The scrollbar-color CSS property sets the color of the scrollbar track and thumb.
scrollbar-color.description_html: The scrollbar-color CSS property sets the color of the scrollbar track and thumb.
scrollbar-color.name: scrollbar-color

scrollbar-gutter.description: The scrollbar-gutter CSS property reserves space for the scrollbar, preventing unwanted layout changes as the scrollbar appears and disappears.
scrollbar-gutter.description_html: The scrollbar-gutter CSS property reserves space for the scrollbar, preventing unwanted layout changes as the scrollbar appears and disappears.
scrollbar-gutter.name: scrollbar-gutter

scrollbar-width.description: The scrollbar-width CSS property sets the width of the scrollbar.
scrollbar-width.description_html: The scrollbar-width CSS property sets the width of the scrollbar.
scrollbar-width.name: scrollbar-width

scrollend.description: The scrollend event fires when an element or document has finished scrolling.
scrollend.description_html: The scrollend event fires when an element or document has finished scrolling.
scrollend.name: scrollend

search.description: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
search.description_html: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
search.name: <search>

search-input-type.description: The <input> HTML element with the type="search" attribute represents a text field for search queries, which might be styled differently by the browser.
search-input-type.description_html: The <input> HTML element with the type="search" attribute represents a text field for search queries, which might be styled differently by the browser.
search-input-type.name: <input type="search">

server-timing.description: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.
server-timing.description_html: The serverTiming property of the PerformanceResourceTiming API contains server timing information about network requests.
server-timing.name: Server timing

set.description: Set objects store unique values of any type.
set.description_html: Set objects store unique values of any type.
set.name: Set (initial support)

set-methods.description: The difference(), intersection(), isDisjointFrom(), isSubsetOf(), isSupersetOf(), symmetricDifference(), and union() methods of the JavaScript Set object performs operations between two sets.
set-methods.description_html: The difference(), intersection(), isDisjointFrom(), isSubsetOf(), isSupersetOf(), symmetricDifference(), and union() methods of the JavaScript Set object performs operations between two sets.
set-methods.name: Set methods

shadow-dom.description: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
shadow-dom.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
shadow-dom.name: Shadow DOM

show-picker-input.description: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
show-picker-input.description_html: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
show-picker-input.name: showPicker() for <input>

show-picker-select.description: The showPicker() method for <select> elements shows the dropdown menu or other user interface for picking one of the options.
show-picker-select.description_html: The showPicker() method for <select> elements shows the dropdown menu or other user interface for picking one of the options.
show-picker-select.name: showPicker() for <select>

slot.description: The <slot> HTML element is a placeholder inside a web component where consumers of the component can insert their own markup.
slot.description_html: The <slot> HTML element is a placeholder inside a web component where consumers of the component can insert their own markup.
slot.name: <slot>

slot-assign.description: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.
slot-assign.description_html: The assign() method for <slot> elements assigns nodes to the slot, as an alternative to using the slot and name HTML attributes. The nodes must be children of a shadow host and the shadow root must be created with the slotAssignment set to "manual". Also known as manual slot assignment.
slot-assign.name: Imperative slot assignment

speech-synthesis.description: The SpeechSynthesis API converts text into audio using a synthetic voice.
speech-synthesis.description_html: The SpeechSynthesis API converts text into audio using a synthetic voice.
speech-synthesis.name: Speech synthesis

spelling-grammar-error.description: The ::spelling-error and ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-elements match text that is highlighted as misspelled and grammatically incorrect, respectively.
spelling-grammar-error.description_html: The ::spelling-error and ::grammar-error CSS pseudo-elements match text that is highlighted as misspelled and grammatically incorrect, respectively.
spelling-grammar-error.name: ::spelling-error and ::grammar-error

starting-style.description: The @starting-style CSS at-rule defines the starting values for properties that are transitioning when the target element's style is first updated.
starting-style.description_html: The @starting-style CSS at-rule defines the starting values for properties that are transitioning when the target element's style is first updated.
starting-style.name: @starting-style

state.description: The :state() CSS pseudo-class matches custom elements based on their custom state, set through the ElementInternals.states API.
state.description_html: The :state() CSS pseudo-class matches custom elements based on their custom state, set through the ElementInternals.states API.
state.name: :state()

sticky-positioning.description: The position: sticky CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow until it crosses a specified threshold, at which points it becomes fixed (stuck) at that position.
sticky-positioning.description_html: The position: sticky CSS declaration positions an element in the normal flow until it crosses a specified threshold, at which points it becomes fixed (stuck) at that position.
sticky-positioning.name: Sticky positioning

storage-access.description: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.
storage-access.description_html: The document.requestStorageAccess() method allows content in iframes to request storing and reading cookies and other site data, while the document.hasStorageAccess() method checks if such access is granted.
storage-access.name: Storage access

storage-buckets.description: The navigator.storageBuckets API allows you to organize locally stored data into groups called storage buckets. Each bucket can have different settings, allowing the browser to manage and delete buckets independently rather than applying the same treatment to all.
storage-buckets.description_html: The navigator.storageBuckets API allows you to organize locally stored data into groups called storage buckets. Each bucket can have different settings, allowing the browser to manage and delete buckets independently rather than applying the same treatment to all.
storage-buckets.name: Storage buckets

streams.description: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.
streams.description_html: The streams API creates, composes, and consumes continuously generated data.
streams.name: Streams

structured-clone.description: The structuredClone() global method creates a deep copy of an object. Values that cannot be cloned can instead be transferred, making the original value no longer usable.
structured-clone.description_html: The structuredClone() global method creates a deep copy of an object. Values that cannot be cloned can instead be transferred, making the original value no longer usable.
structured-clone.name: structuredClone()

subgrid.description: The subgrid value for the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows properties allows a grid item to inherit the grid definition of its parent grid container.
subgrid.description_html: The subgrid value for the grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows properties allows a grid item to inherit the grid definition of its parent grid container.
subgrid.name: Subgrid

tabindex.description: The tabindex HTML attribute make an element focusable, and defines the element's relative ordering for sequential focus navigation.
tabindex.description_html: The tabindex HTML attribute make an element focusable, and defines the element's relative ordering for sequential focus navigation.
tabindex.name: tabindex

target-text.description: The ::target-text pseudo-element allows you to style text highlighted by a URL text fragment such as #:~:text=snippet.
target-text.description_html: The ::target-text pseudo-element allows you to style text highlighted by a URL text fragment such as #:~:text=snippet.
target-text.name: ::target-text

template.description: The <template> HTML element holds HTML fragments which you can clone and insert into the document using JavaScript.
template.description_html: The <template> HTML element holds HTML fragments which you can clone and insert into the document using JavaScript.
template.name: <template>

temporal.description: The Temporal API allows you to work with dates, times, time zones, and durations. It is more powerful than the Date API.
temporal.description_html: The Temporal API allows you to work with dates, times, time zones, and durations. It is more powerful than the Date API.
temporal.name: Temporal

text-indent.description: The text-indent CSS property sets the size of the empty space (indentation) at the beginning of lines in a text.
text-indent.description_html: The text-indent CSS property sets the size of the empty space (indentation) at the beginning of lines in a text.
text-indent.name: text-indent

text-spacing-trim.description: The text-spacing-trim CSS property controls spacing around CJK characters, avoiding excessive whitespace when using full-width punctuation characters.
text-spacing-trim.description_html: The text-spacing-trim CSS property controls spacing around CJK characters, avoiding excessive whitespace when using full-width punctuation characters.
text-spacing-trim.name: text-spacing-trim

text-wrap-balance.description: The text-wrap: balance CSS declaration balances the length of each line when text is broken into multiple lines. Also known as headline balancing.
text-wrap-balance.description_html: The text-wrap: balance CSS declaration balances the length of each line when text is broken into multiple lines. Also known as headline balancing.
text-wrap-balance.name: text-wrap: balance

text-wrap-nowrap.description: The text-wrap: nowrap CSS declaration prevents text breaking into multiple lines. Text that doesn't fit overflows instead.
text-wrap-nowrap.description_html: The text-wrap: nowrap CSS declaration prevents text breaking into multiple lines. Text that doesn't fit overflows instead.
text-wrap-nowrap.name: text-wrap: nowrap

text-wrap-pretty.description: The text-wrap: pretty CSS declaration prioritizes better layout over speed when text is broken into multiple lines.
text-wrap-pretty.description_html: The text-wrap: pretty CSS declaration prioritizes better layout over speed when text is broken into multiple lines.
text-wrap-pretty.name: text-wrap: pretty

time.description: The <time> HTML element represents a time, such as a calendar date, clock time, or duration. It may include the datetime attribute to translate dates into machine-readable format.
time.description_html: The <time> HTML element represents a time, such as a calendar date, clock time, or duration. It may include the datetime attribute to translate dates into machine-readable format.
time.name: <time>

transferable-arraybuffer.description: The transfer() and transferToFixedLength() methods of ArrayBuffer move a buffer from one context to another (for example, to a worker).
transferable-arraybuffer.description_html: The transfer() and transferToFixedLength() methods of ArrayBuffer move a buffer from one context to another (for example, to a worker).
transferable-arraybuffer.name: Transferable ArrayBuffer

transforms2d.description: The transform CSS property and its 2D transform functions allow rotating, scaling, skewing, and translating an element. Arbitrary 2D transforms are also possible using a transformation matrix.
transforms2d.description_html: The transform CSS property and its 2D transform functions allow rotating, scaling, skewing, and translating an element. Arbitrary 2D transforms are also possible using a transformation matrix.
transforms2d.name: 2D transforms

transforms3d.description: The transform CSS property and its 3D transform functions allow rotations and other transforms in three dimensions, including perspective transforms.
transforms3d.description_html: The transform CSS property and its 3D transform functions allow rotations and other transforms in three dimensions, including perspective transforms.
transforms3d.name: 3D transforms

transition-behavior.description: The transition-behavior: allow-discrete CSS declaration allows transitions for properties whose animation behavior is discrete. Such properties can't be interpolated and swap from their start value to the end value at 50%.
transition-behavior.description_html: The transition-behavior: allow-discrete CSS declaration allows transitions for properties whose animation behavior is discrete. Such properties can't be interpolated and swap from their start value to the end value at 50%.
transition-behavior.name: transition-behavior

translate.description: The translate HTML attribute marks whether an element's text should be translated.
translate.description_html: The translate HTML attribute marks whether an element's text should be translated.
translate.name: translate attribute

trig-functions.description: The sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2() CSS functions compute various trigonometric functions.
trig-functions.description_html: The sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2() CSS functions compute various trigonometric functions.
trig-functions.name: sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan(), and atan2()

trusted-types.description: Trusted types allow you to lock down insecure parts of the DOM API and prevent client-side cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
trusted-types.description_html: Trusted types allow you to lock down insecure parts of the DOM API and prevent client-side cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
trusted-types.name: Trusted types

two-value-display.description: The display CSS property accepts multiple keyword values, such as inline flex or block flow, to explicitly set an element's inner and outer layout mode. Also known as 2-value, multi-keyword, or multiple value syntax.
two-value-display.description_html: The display CSS property accepts multiple keyword values, such as inline flex or block flow, to explicitly set an element's inner and outer layout mode. Also known as 2-value, multi-keyword, or multiple value syntax.
two-value-display.name: Two-value display property

typed-array-iterators.description: Typed arrays are iterable with the for…of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
typed-array-iterators.description_html: Typed arrays are iterable with the for…of statement and enumerable with the methods entries(), keys(), and values().
typed-array-iterators.name: Typed array iterators

typed-arrays.description: Typed arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values, where all values are of the same numerical type, such as 8-bit integers or 32-bit floating point numbers.
typed-arrays.description_html: Typed arrays are ordered lists of JavaScript values, where all values are of the same numerical type, such as 8-bit integers or 32-bit floating point numbers.
typed-arrays.name: Typed arrays (initial support)

url-canparse.description: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a try…catch statement.
url-canparse.description_html: The URL.canParse() static method checks whether a URL can be parsed into a valid URL object. It's an alternative to calling new URL() in a try…catch statement.
url-canparse.name: URL.canParse()

urlpattern.description: The URLPattern API creates patterns that can be matched against URLs or URL components.
urlpattern.description_html: The URLPattern API creates patterns that can be matched against URLs or URL components.
urlpattern.name: URLPattern

user-activation.description: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.
user-activation.description_html: The navigator.userActivation API reveals whether the user has interacted with the page through an "activation" gesture such as a click, tap, or key press. User activation gated APIs (such as the fullscreen API) fail without user interaction, and this API allows you to predict such a failure.
user-activation.name: User activation

user-pseudos.description: The :user-valid and :user-invalid pseudo-classes match form controls that have been marked as valid or invalid based on their validation constraints.
user-pseudos.description_html: The :user-valid and :user-invalid pseudo-classes match form controls that have been marked as valid or invalid based on their validation constraints.
user-pseudos.name: :user-valid and :user-invalid

view-transitions.description: View transitions allow you to create animated visual transitions between different states of a document, or between different documents.
view-transitions.description_html: View transitions allow you to create animated visual transitions between different states of a document, or between different documents.
view-transitions.name: View transitions

viewport-unit-variants.description: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-unit-variants.description_html: The sv*, lv*, and dv* CSS viewport units are relative to the smallest, largest, and current (dynamic) viewport size. They are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-unit-variants.name: Small, large, and dynamic viewport units

viewport-units.description: The vw, vh, vmin, and vmax CSS viewport units are relative to the size of the viewport, and are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-units.description_html: The vw, vh, vmin, and vmax CSS viewport units are relative to the size of the viewport, and are used to size elements in relation to the viewport's dimensions.
viewport-units.name: Viewport units

visual-viewport.description: The visualViewport API provides a way to query and modify the user-visible viewport of a web page.
visual-viewport.description_html: The visualViewport API provides a way to query and modify the user-visible viewport of a web page.
visual-viewport.name: Visual viewport API

wasm-simd.description: The 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) extension to WebAssembly performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.
wasm-simd.description_html: The 128-bit SIMD (Single Instruction Multiple Data) extension to WebAssembly performs one instruction on multiple units of data, when running on hardware that supports such instructions. Also known as vector instructions.
wasm-simd.name: WebAssembly SIMD

web-animations.description: The web animations API allows you to animate and synchronize the animations of DOM elements.
web-animations.description_html: The web animations API allows you to animate and synchronize the animations of DOM elements.
web-animations.name: Web animations

web-bluetooth.description: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.
web-bluetooth.description_html: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.
web-bluetooth.name: Web Bluetooth

web-locks.description: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.
web-locks.description_html: The navigator.locks API coordinates work with shared resources through mutually exclusive ownership of a resource's name. Also known as web locks.
web-locks.name: Locks

web-midi.description: The Web MIDI API enables selecting MIDI input and output devices and sending and receiving MIDI messages.
web-midi.description_html: The Web MIDI API enables selecting MIDI input and output devices and sending and receiving MIDI messages.
web-midi.name: Web MIDI

web-nfc.description: The NDEFReader API reads and writes messages to near-field communication (NFC) tags.
web-nfc.description_html: The NDEFReader API reads and writes messages to near-field communication (NFC) tags.
web-nfc.name: Web NFC

webauthn-public-key-easy.description: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.
webauthn-public-key-easy.description_html: The getAuthenticatorData(), getPublicKey(), and getPublicKeyAlgorithm() methods of AuthenticatorAttestationResponse access credential data inside attestationObject without the need to parse it.
webauthn-public-key-easy.name: Web authentication easy public key access

webcodecs.description: The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to individual video frames and chunks of audio samples, for full control over the way media is processed.
webcodecs.description_html: The WebCodecs API provides low-level access to individual video frames and chunks of audio samples, for full control over the way media is processed.
webcodecs.name: WebCodecs

webdriver-bidi.description: WebDriver BiDi is a bidirectional protocol that allows a WebDriver client and a browser to communicate with each other.
webdriver-bidi.description_html: WebDriver BiDi is a bidirectional protocol that allows a WebDriver client and a browser to communicate with each other.
webdriver-bidi.name: WebDriver BiDi

webgl-oes-draw-buffers-indexed.description: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension to WebGL allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.
webgl-oes-draw-buffers-indexed.description_html: The OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension to WebGL allows you to control blending on a per-color basis when writing to multiple color buffers simultaneously.
webgl-oes-draw-buffers-indexed.name: WebGL OES_draw_buffers_indexed extension

webhid.description: The WebHID API provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID) that are connected to the user's device.
webhid.description_html: The WebHID API provides access to Human Interface Devices (HID) that are connected to the user's device.
webhid.name: WebHID

webnn.description: The WebNN API constructs and executes computational graphs of neural networks by making use of the various machine learning capabilities and hardware accelerators available on the device. Also known as Web Neural Network API.
webnn.description_html: The WebNN API constructs and executes computational graphs of neural networks by making use of the various machine learning capabilities and hardware accelerators available on the device. Also known as Web Neural Network API.
webnn.name: WebNN

webp.description: The WebP image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
webp.description_html: The WebP image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
webp.name: WebP

webrtc.description: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.
webrtc.description_html: The WebRTC API establishes real-time communication channels directly between browsers. It is commonly used in video conferencing applications.
webrtc.name: WebRTC

webrtc-encoded-transform.description: The WebRTC encoded transform API allows you to modify audio and video streams in WebRTC connections. For example, it can be used for visual effects or custom codecs.
webrtc-encoded-transform.description_html: The WebRTC encoded transform API allows you to modify audio and video streams in WebRTC connections. For example, it can be used for visual effects or custom codecs.
webrtc-encoded-transform.name: WebRTC encoded transform

webrtc-sctp.description: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.
webrtc-sctp.description_html: The sctp object on RTCPeerConnection represents the negotiated SCTP transport. SCTP (Stream Control Transmission Protocol) is the protocol that RTCDataChannel uses.
webrtc-sctp.name: WebRTC SCTP information

webtransport.description: The WebTransport API transmits data between a client and a server, by using the HTTP/3 protocol.
webtransport.description_html: The WebTransport API transmits data between a client and a server, by using the HTTP/3 protocol.
webtransport.name: WebTransport

webusb.description: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.
webusb.description_html: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.
webusb.name: WebUSB

webvtt.description: WebVTT is a captions and subtitles format. WebVTT files are loaded using the <track> element, and the VTTCue API can be used to create or update cues dynamically.
webvtt.description_html: WebVTT is a captions and subtitles format. WebVTT files are loaded using the <track> element, and the VTTCue API can be used to create or update cues dynamically.
webvtt.name: WebVTT

webvtt-cue-alignment.description: The WebVTT cue alignment settings control which part of the cue is aligned with the given line and position. Cue alignment is set using line and position settings in WebVTT files or the lineAlign and positionAlign properties of VTTCue using JavaScript.
webvtt-cue-alignment.description_html: The WebVTT cue alignment settings control which part of the cue is aligned with the given line and position. Cue alignment is set using line and position settings in WebVTT files or the lineAlign and positionAlign properties of VTTCue using JavaScript.
webvtt-cue-alignment.name: WebVTT cue alignment

webvtt-regions.description: WebVTT regions set the areas of the video where captions or subtitles should be rendered, such as placing roll-up captions used for live captions.
webvtt-regions.description_html: WebVTT regions set the areas of the video where captions or subtitles should be rendered, such as placing roll-up captions used for live captions.
webvtt-regions.name: WebVTT regions

where.description: The :where() CSS functional pseudo-class takes a selector list as its argument, and matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list. It is functionally equivalent to the selectors in the list, but doesn't affect the CSS rule specificity.
where.description_html: The :where() CSS functional pseudo-class takes a selector list as its argument, and matches any element that can be selected by one of the selectors in that list. It is functionally equivalent to the selectors in the list, but doesn't affect the CSS rule specificity.
where.name: :where()

will-change.description: The will-change CSS property gives hints to the browser about expected changes to an element's scroll position, contents, or style. These hints allow browsers to optimize for upcoming style changes.
will-change.description_html: The will-change CSS property gives hints to the browser about expected changes to an element's scroll position, contents, or style. These hints allow browsers to optimize for upcoming style changes.
will-change.name: will-change

xhr.description: The XMLHttpRequest API makes HTTP requests. It's the predecessor to fetch(). Also known as XHR.
xhr.description_html: The XMLHttpRequest API makes HTTP requests. It's the predecessor to fetch(). Also known as XHR.
xhr.name: XMLHttpRequest

zoom.description: The zoom CSS property scales the size of an element. Unlike the transform property, a zoomed element affects page layout.
zoom.description_html: The zoom CSS property scales the size of an element. Unlike the transform property, a zoomed element affects page layout.
zoom.name: zoom
